sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Legends of Saints. Prayers. Mandeville's Travels. Odoricus of Pordenone, Itinerary
Legends, etc.
msDesc.p: Vellum, 275 180 10.8 x 7.2, ff. 3 + 255, double columns of 42 lines, Quire 30 is on smaller vellum 8.8 x 5.2, 25 lines to a page. Cent. xv and xiii, in rather current hand.
The old foliation errs by one in a great part of the book, but is used in the description.

On f. iiv is stuck a label, formerly on the outside of the cover: M (red) T. Markaunt ... 21. Liber diversorum tractatuum. videlicet.
List of contents as in Markaunt's list (Sources, p. 77) ending: cuius sec. fo. inc. in enigmate. Pe(nult) fo. inc. ueni sed dolor misere. (This latter is now the last leaf.)
On f. iiiv another list of contents.

head.title: Tractatus de oratione dominica in septem petitiones divisa

msItem.incipit: Oracio est pius affectus mentis
msItem.explicit: ad laudem et honorem nominis Ihesu Christi. Amen

msItem.head: pseudo-Bonaventure OFM, De officio missae
msItem.incipit: Ad missam celebrandam sex consideracio attendenda
msItem.explicit: opere impleat quod nobis concedat qui, etc.
msItem.rubric: Officium misse de veneracione suppremi nominis Ihesu Christi
msItem.incipit: In nomine Ihesu omne genu
Dulcis Ihesus nazarenus iudeorum rex amenus
Dulce nomen Ihesu Christi
O maria virgo virginum que genuisti filium
msItem.explicit: virtutum augmentacio

msItem.head: Honorius III, Approbatio regulae Sancti Francisci
msItem.incipit: Regula et vita minorum fratrum

explicit.date: tercio(?) kal. decembris pontificatus nostri anno viij

msItem.head: Anselm of Canterbury OSB, Oratio ad sanctam Mariam Magdalenam (Oratio 16)
msItem.incipit: Sancta maria magdalene que cum fonte lacrimarum
msItem.explicit: nec celerius hoc exprimi potuit

head.title: Vita protoplasti Adae et Evae uxoris ejus

msItem.incipit: Factum est ut cum expulsi essent Adam
msItem.ab: (Ed. W. Meyer, 1879 in Sitzungsberichte d. k. k. Bayer. Akad. from other MSS.)
msItem.explicit: et dixit. adam. et dixit dominus sic vocatum est nomen eius
msItem.incipit: Post peccatum ade expulso eodem
msItem.explicit: obedientem patri usque ad mortem cui est laus et honor et imperium per omnia secula seculorum

msItem.head: pseudo-Methodius, De initio et fine saeculi

head.title: Epistola Methodii Martiris de inicio, progressu, de die judicii et de Millenario

msItem.incipit: Sciendum est nos, fratres karissimi, quomodo in principio
msItem.explicit: unde nos eripere dignetur dominus noster Ihesus Christus qui etc. per infinita secula seculorum
msItem.ab: Ed. in Orthodoxographa of Grynaeus, etc. See Oudin I 299; Sackur, Sibyllinische Texte

msItem.head: Honorius Augustodunensis, Imago mundi
msItem.rubric: Ad instruccionem multorum quibus deest copia librorum, etc.
msItem.incipit: Mundus dicitur quasi (?) undique motus
msItem.explicit: in eadem linea graditur
msItem.ab: Attributed to Gregory of Huntingdon and Henry of Mainz

msItem.head: H[enry?] of Sawtry OCist, Purgatorium Sancti Patricii
msItem.incipit: Patri suo peroptato in Christo H. abbati de sartis
msItem.explicit: seruituram in monasterio commendauit. Tu autem domine miserere nostri
msItem.ab: By Henry of Sawtry: see Ward, Catalogue of Romances II 435

msItem.incipit: Sanctus Brendanus filius fin locha
msItem.explicit: gloriose migrauit ad dominum cui est honor et gloria in seculorum secula. amen
msItem.rubric: Explicit vita Sancti Brendani abbatis de diuersis miraculis
msItem.ab: Ed. Schroder, Sanct Brandan (1871), Moran, Acta Sancti Brendani (1872). See Ward, Catalogue of Romances II, p. 516. BHL. 1437

msItem.rubric: Sanctus Brandanus Dei servus fecit istam orationem de verbo Dei per Michaelem archangelum in medio maris: quicunque cantaverit orationem istam pro se vel amico suo pro anima sua vel pro anima amici sui, sive pro vivis sive pro defunctis, cum fide catholica et oratione dominica et simbolo genuflectans XII vicibus, peccata sua remittentur ei, et salvus erit de penis futuris: pretium cantandi orationem istam super altare vel super sepulcrum defuncti, genuflectans cum oratione dominica et fide catholica XII vicibus valet centum psaltaria et centum missas et centum commemorationes, auctoritate spiritus sancti docente sancto Brandano
msItem.incipit: Per sanctam annunciacionem tuam domine Ihesu Christe
msItem.explicit: in domo misericordie tue
msItem.rubric: Explicit de ueteri testamento, incipit de nouo
msItem.incipit: Libera me domine sicut liberasti Zachariam
msItem.ab: Other prayers follow: the last (Missus est Gabriel) ends
msItem.explicit: celestium gaudiorum prestante eodem domino Ihesu Christo qui, etc. per omnia secula seculorum. amen
msItem.ab: Ed. by Moran, Acta Sancti Brendani (1872)

msItem.head: Jean le Long OSB (attrib.), The travels of Sir John Mandeville

head.title: Itinerarium Iohannis Mandeville de mirabilibus mundi

msItem.incipit: Cum terra ultra marina, viz. terra sancta
msItem.explicit: aliquod minuit qui in claritate uiuit et regnat deus per infinita secula seculorum. amen
msItem.rubric: Explicit liber de mirabilibus mundi editus a Johanne Mandeuyle milite cuius anime propicietur deus amen

msItem.head: Iohannes presbyter ('Prester John'), Epistola Manueli Comneno imperatori Graecorum
msItem.incipit: Presbiter Johannes potencia et virtute dei ... Emanueli Romeon gubernatore
msItem.explicit: ciborum essemus inpleti. valete

msItem.head: Odoricus of Pordenone, Itinerarium

head.title: Itinerarium fratris Odorici ordinis fratrum minorum de mirabilibus orientalium Tartarorum

msItem.incipit: Licet multa et uaria de ritibus et condicionibus
msItem.explicit: Ego frater Odoricus hic inscripsi et si (?) multa mirabilia omisi ponere quia homines non credidissent nisi uidissent

msItem.head: Francesco Petrarca, Historia Griseldis

head.title: Francisci Petrarchi, lauriati poetae, de Waltero Saluciarum Marchione et Griscildi ejus uxore, historia

msItem.incipit: Est ad Ytalie latus occiduum
msItem.explicit: rusticana hec muliercula passa est

msItem.head: John of Hildesheim OCarm, Historia trium regum

head.title: Liber de gestis et translationibus sanctorum trium regum qui Christum adorarunt

msItem.incipit: In primo capitulo huius libri qui est collectus
Cum venerandorum trium magorum
Nota quod nomina trium magorum
msItem.explicit: sed hii tres reges virgines fuerunt
msItem.ab: Cf. MS 179. Horstmann considers that the author of the English version (printed by him for E. E. T. S.) used this copy or one very like it. The Latin is by John of Hildesheim

head.title: Vita Secundi philosophi de Graeco in Latinum translata

msItem.incipit: Secundus fuit philosophus. hic philosophus omni tempore silencium conseruans
msItem.explicit: tres pariter custodi trinitas ter sancta
msItem.ab: Translated from the Greek by William of Gap, monk and afterwards abbot of St Denis. Often printed: e.g. Philologus 1862 and 1877: last by A. Hilka, Breslau 1910, in Jahresbericht d. schlesischen Ges. f¸r v‰terl. Cultur

msItem.head: John Grandisson, Vita Sancti Thomae Cantuariensis

head.title: Vita et passio S. Thomae archiepiscopi Cantuariensi composita per dominum Iohannem de Grandissono episcopum Exoniensem

msItem.incipit: Benediccionibus diuine dulcedinis
msItem.explicit: festumque eius solempniter celebrandum ad laudem et gloriam domini nostri Ihesu Christi qui, etc.
msItem.rubric: Explicit vita et passio Sancti Thome archiepiscopi Cantuariensi compositus per dominum Johannem de grandisono Episcopum Exoniensem

msItem.head: Alan of Tewkesbury OSB, Vita Sancti Thomae Cantuariensis

ab.quote: Hi quaterniones qui et forma et charactere (sunt enim in octavo et majorem sapiunt antiquitatem prae reliquis hujus codicis partibus) discrepant tum a precedentibus tum ab eis qui sequuntur, priorem duntaxat partem vitae ipsius Thomae continent; et autor, quisquis fuerit, in animo habuit summatim perstringere ea quae contigerunt a concilio de Clarendon ad mortem archiepiscopi, ut suppleret quae propter brevitatem omisit Iohannes [Salisbury] Carnotensis in historia sua

msItem.ab: Inserted between ff. 233v and 234r: smaller page: good hand of cent. xiii, ff. 14
msItem.incipit: Gloriosus dei martir Thomas qualis
msItem.explicit: commota sunt paterne pietatis uiscera super filio
msItem.ab: By Alan of Tewkesbury. P. L. CXC 207, Robertson, Materials II 322

head.title: De Saracenis et eorum observationibus et de Mahometo

msItem.incipit: Saraceni sunt qui de ancilla habrae ad quam iubente sarra ingressus
msItem.explicit: xl die post obitum patris moriendo patrem secuta est

msItem.incipit: Legitur in quadam hystoria quod quidam vir fuit in ierusalem nomine Ruben
msItem.explicit: et in aere cum demonibus scitaretur (sociaretur)
msItem.ab: See Legenda Aurea (s. v. Sanctus Matthias: ed. Graesse, p. 184)
msItem.incipit: Judas scarioth fratrem suum putatiuum
msItem.explicit: crepuit in medio diffusis vi(s)ceribus

head.title: Expositio in Isaiae Lupus et agnus pascentur
Expositio in illud Isaiae Lupus et Agnus pascentur

msItem.incipit: Lupus et agnus pascentur simul. Ysa. lxv. hinc (?) necesse est omnes sacras scripturas impleri
msItem.ab: Ends imperfectly, one leaf of text probably wanting

recordHist.p: markupCheck: checked by SP, BA, CF
